title.native: プロジェクトセカイ 壊れたセカイと歌えないミク
title.romaji: Project Sekai: Kowareta SEKAI to Utaenai MIKU
title.english: COLORFUL STAGE! The Movie: A Miku Who Can't Sing

description:
Set in modern day Shibuya, Ichika Hoshino, a high school girl and street musician, encounters an unknown version of Hatsune Miku after hearing a Miku song that she'd never heard before in a CD store. Ichika learns that this version of Miku is having trouble reaching people with her songs, so together they team up to try to touch the hearts of their audience through music.

(Source: Crunchyroll News, edited)
synonyms: Colorful Stage La Película: Miku no puede cantar
Colorful Stage! เดอะมูฟวี่: มิกุที่ไร้เสียงเพลง

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Vocal Synth
tags.description: Features one or more singers or characters that are products of a synthesize singing program. Popular examples are Vocaloids, UTAUloids, and CeVIOs.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Hip-hop Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of hip-hop, not to be applied to anime that use hip-hop in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

title.native: ぷちセカ
プロジェクトセカイ カラフルステージ！ feat.初音ミク　コミックアンソロジー
Journey to Bloom
セカイの4コマ

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masatoshitsuji)

Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). Former [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) employee, currently freelance.

Affiliated with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/) since 2009.

Debuted as a character designer on [Irozuku Sekai no Ashita kara](https://anilist.co/anime/101316/).

Affiliated with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/) since 2009.

Debuted as a character designer on [Irozuku Sekai no Ashita kara](https://anilist.co/anime/101316/).

Houno Satoshi is a Japanese composer and arranger, affiliated with Sound Drive.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/s_hono)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masatoshitsuji)

Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). Former [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) employee, currently freelance.
